cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 120 mi SE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west, then WNW and NW, expected to approach and make landfall along the central Louisiana coast and then move inland toward Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Intracoastal City–Morgan City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch Mouth of Pearl River to Intracoastal City, hurricane watch Mouth of Mississippi River to Cameron LA, tropical-storm watch Mouth of Mississippi River to Mouth of Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast, especially Louisiana, with lesser effects extending westward to the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge around 1–2 ft possible on the upper Texas coast including Texas City
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rainfall possible in outer rainbands Friday-Saturday with local higher amounts
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief coastal flooding of low-lying roads, isolated tornadoes in rainbands
